author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Cops: Man fatally ran over girlfriend in front of her children
summary: PHOENIX -- Authorities say a man has been arrested for allegedly fatally running over his girlfriend in the parking lot of a Phoenix club in front of her two children. Police say 26-year-old Ricardo Garcia is being held on suspicion of one count of first-degree murder and four counts of aggravated assault. They say 28-year-old Anjelica Moraga died of her injuries at a hospital early Sunday. According to police, Moraga and Garcia argued late Saturday night outside the club and he rammed into his girlfriend's vehicle, causing minor damage. Inside the car were two other adults and Moraga's two children. Police say Moraga was outside of her vehicle in the parking lot when Garcia allegedly ran her

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Thousands flee as wildfires ravage California; at least 15 killed
summary: Massive wildfires sweeping through parts of California have killed at least 15 people and damaged more than 1,500 residences and other buildings, according to authorities. Firefighters were battling 17 fires across multiple counties in the state as of late Monday, authorities said. Intensified by strong winds, the fires charred about 115,000 acres of land, destroyed at least 1,500 buildings and forced nearly 20,000 residents to evacuate.

author: third_watch
title: Vegas police change shooting timeline: Guard alerted security before gunman opened fire
summary: It has been a week since Stephen Paddock, a 64-year-old retired accountant and high-stakes video poker player, opened fire on 22,000 country music fans from his 32nd-floor suite in Las Vegas’ Mandalay Bay Resort on the city’s Sunset Strip, killing 58 people and wounding hundreds of others before fatally shooting himself in the head. On Monday, Clark County Sheriff Joseph Lombardo announced a change to the sequence of events that occurred on Oct. 1, saying a security guard who encountered Paddock was shot at 9:59 p.m. local time, minutes before Paddock unleashed a hail of gunfire on unsuspecting concertgoers. Previously, authorities said that the security guard, Jesus Campos, was shot after Paddock had opened fire on the crowd below.

author: third_watch
title: Man Gives Reward to Kidnapped Girl: 'It's the Best Thing I've Ever Done'
summary: By sheer chance, Earl Melchert discovered a teenage girl on his property who had been missing for 29 days.
